title: Bachelorette spoiler! A suitor has his rose TAKEN AWAY for the first time in the show's history
text:
The Bachelorette is set to make history this week.

According to TV Week, Angie Kent will give one of her suitors a rose before dramatically taking it away from him.

The identity of the unlucky gentleman hasn't been revealed, but it can be assumed that Carlin Sterritt, Jackson Garlick, Ryan Anderson and Timm Hanly are safe, given that they are known to make Angie's top four.

Scroll down for video

Change of heart: The Bachelorette is set to make history this week amid reports Angie Kent (pictured) will give one of her suitors a rose before dramatically taking it away from him

By process of elimination, this means Angie will take a rose away from either Alex McKay, Haydn Trick, Jamie Doran, Ciarran Stott or Matt Whyatt.

It follows reports that a front-runner is set to quit the show in an upcoming episode after his grandmother died during filming.

According to a well-placed source, a producer told the contestant the sad news off camera in July and he immediately flew home for the funeral.

Who will it be? The identity of the unlucky gentleman hasn't been revealed, but it can be assumed that Carlin Sterritt, Jackson Garlick, Ryan Anderson and Timm Hanly (pictured) are safe, given that they are known to make Angie's top four

Sad twist: It follows reports that a Bachelorette front-runner is set to quit the show in an upcoming episode after his grandmother died during filming

Daily Mail Australia understands the suitor filmed an emotional scene in which he told Angie of his decision to leave, but it is unclear if the conversation will be aired.

The insider said: 'The news sent shockwaves through the show, but everybody understood and respected his decision to go and be with his family.'

During production, contestants are cut off from the outside world and have no access to mobile phones to interact with anybody back home.

Exit: According to a source, a producer told the contestant the sad news off camera in July and he immediately flew home for the funeral. Pictured: Angie and Carlin Sterritt

Heartbreaking: Daily Mail Australia understands the suitor filmed an emotional scene in which he told Angie of his decision to leave, but it is unclear if the conversation will be aired

Instead, a handful of their closest friends and family are given a contact person at production company Warner Bros. Australia in case of an emergency.

The contestant's sad departure follows a string of unexpected exits this year.

During the show's second episode, Angie kicked Noosa politician Jess Glasgow to the kerb for his 'inappropriate' remarks during a photo shoot-themed group date.

Warwick Adams later quit after being made to dress up in a chicken suit.
description: The Bachelorette is set to make history this week amid reports Angie Kent will give one of her suitors a rose before dramatically taking it away from him.
authors: Joshua Fox For Daily Mail Australia
